    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static PlaylistManager getInstance()

      • selectDirectory

        public static void selectDirectory()
        Opens a default system window to select a directory and captures its absolute path. It also calls the createPlaylist method.

      • createPlaylist

        private static void createPlaylist(java.lang.String directoryName,
                                   java.util.List<java.io.File> files)
        Searches for mp3 files in a starting directory path and all of its subsequent directories. Creates a song instance for every mp3 file and adds it to the songs array. Calls the method that writes every mp3 file path into the m3u file.
        Parameters:
        directoryName - The absolute path to search for mp3 files
        files - List to collect all mp3 files found in a directory. On the first input it's always empty, but is necessary, because the function is called recursively further.

      • createSong

        private static Song createSong(java.lang.String songFilePath)
        Creates a new song object based on the mp3 file path and collects the song information from the ID3 tags.
        Parameters:
        songFilePath - The path of the mp3 file
        Returns:
        a new song object
        See Also:
        Song

      • writeM3UFile

        private static void writeM3UFile()
        Checks first if the m3u file exists. If not, creates it and calls the method again. Writes down one mp3 file path per line. The paths come from the songs array.

      • loadPlaylistFromM3UFile

        public static void loadPlaylistFromM3UFile()
        Reads the playlist m3u file line by line and loads the songs array with the song instances.

      • cleanM3UFile

        public static void cleanM3UFile()
        Simply deletes everything in the playlist.m3u file

      • checkPlaylistStatus

        public void checkPlaylistStatus()
        Called at the application start, checks if the m3u playlist file is filled or empty and sets the playlist status. Is the playlist filled, calls the method to read the m3u file and load the songs array.
        See Also:
        start() method

      • formatTime

        public static java.lang.String formatTime(int milliseconds)
        Formats the time to a String like mm:ss
        Parameters:
        milliseconds -
        Returns:

      • getSelectedSongPath

        public final java.lang.String getSelectedSongPath()

      • setSelectedSongPath

        public final void setSelectedSongPath(java.lang.String selectedSongPath)
